intro: Bunium longipes var. depressum, commonly known as the depressed bunium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are aromatic and contain essential oils, which contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. This variety is distinguished by its shorter stature and more compact growth habit compared to the typical form of Bunium longipes.
